bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to C. H. Crane, February 18, 1875

div1.p: Reed declines an appointment as Acting Assistant Surgeon, United States Army. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to C. H. Crane, February 18, 1875
div1.opener:
No. 235 South 9th st.
Office of the Sanitary Superintendent
No. 66 Court Street
Brooklyn, February 18th 1875.
C. H. Crane, M.D.
Asst. Surgeon General U.S.A.
Sir:
div1.p:
Your let-
ter notifying me of my success before
the Army Medical Board has been
received. In reply, I would respect-
fully state that in as much as I am,
at present, pleasantly situated and
am engaged in business matters which
I desire to bring to a proper termination
before entering the Service, I respectfully
decline the offer of the position of Act-
ing Asst. Surgeon, U.S.A.

closer.salute:
I remain,
Very respectfully,
Your obt. Servant,
